page.title: 16HANWORTH
page.content: Hanworth is a small part of the town of Feltham and it has a very historic past. Most of the land that has now been built on in Hanworth used to be the Royal hunting grounds from Hampton Court in the days of King Henry VIII. What open land there is left served as an airfield both before and after the Second World War. The Mount (the centre of Hanworth) was built as an Ice House for Hanworth Park House in about 1875. This building was used as the headquaters for the Royal Navy Association up until 1962. The lodge was then demolished and Feltham swimming baths were built on the site much to the annoyance of many people. Today Hanworth is like a little town it has its own library,banks,post office,garages and shops.
